data.text: The part or parts that face out; the outer surface.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The part or side of an object that is presented to the viewer; the external aspect.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The space beyond a boundary or limit.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A position at a distance from the inside or center, as of a playing field or racetrack.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: We'll be leaving in ten days at the outside.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Of, relating to, or being on or near the outer side; outer.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Of, restricted to, or situated on the outer side of an enclosure or a boundary; external.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: an outside door lock; an outside antenna.
